title: Organization Design & Development Sr Manager
description:
Organization Development Sr Manager
Job SummaryThe Sr Manager Organization Development works in close cooperation with the Sr Manager, Americas Organization Development Lead. This position manages key projects within the Organization Effectiveness workstream of Americas Strategic Workforce Planning (SWP) for all Americas markets. The Sr Manager serves as an extension of the Org Effectiveness workstream in LATAM markets, advising business partners, intake and scoping of projects, and progress tracking for organization optimization projects throughout the business. The Sr Manager will distill numerous inputs/ideas into meaningful actions and culturally relevant recommendations on the organization. The Sr Manager is expected to be a change agent and champion of workforce analytics, a connector across HR projects and teams, and, as a member of the Strategic Workforce Planning (SWP) leadership team, significantly contributes to building the SWP brand within the region and globally by supporting its mission and principles.
Job FunctionsAs a part of Strategic Workforce Planning, offers expertise to support optimization of organizational structure, design, process, and strategy. Drives a data-driven approach for organization assessment and direction-setting.Personally manage and upskill HRBPs in organization design projects, fostering the development of capabilities, operating models, and structures needed to support the execution of business strategy. Conduct organizational analysis to understand root causes to organizational performance issues and opportunities using key data elements such as span of control, attrition, etc., including recommendations and benchmarks. Collaborate with HRBPs to review current organizational structures and measures; build plans to support vital changes for enterprise and functional long-term strategies. Partner with Sr HR Director LATAM to support leaders in organizational changes, providing process and project management tools that facilitate a proactive development of organizational capabilities. Champion and coach through implementation and sustainability of Americas Position Management, Job Catalog, Skills Implementation, and Cost Center Hierarchy to maintain strong foundation of organizational data for SWP tools and org design.Serve as a key point of contact with LATAM HR and Business Leaders. Enhance and maintain toolkit of best practices for organization development to enable HR Business Partners to assess and develop optimization plans for business areas they support. 
Minimum Qualifications and Demonstrated Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
Superior analytical capabilities with the ability to augment quantitative analyses with qualitative inputs, bringing forward actionable insights for HR and business leaders.Excellent oral and written communication skills, including ability to engage with and influence business leaders and HR Business Partners with complex and/or conceptual information.Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills; ability to balance multiple priorities and meet deadlines as required.Strong knowledge of workforce analytics and planning principles, trends and best practices.Excellent project management skillsStrong Excel, database management skills and familiarity with visualization tools (Tableau, etc).
Education and Experience: Bachelor’s degree in business administration/strategy, finance, HR, or related degree. Advanced degree (MBA) preferred.7+ years progressive professional experience in a related field utilizing analytics and visualization tools to improve business outcomes; Cross-functional experience is desired.3+ years as a manager. Proven leadership ability providing leadership, coaching, guidance, and training to develop staff. Supervised subordinates or contractors with somewhat differentiated roles.

title: Service Quality Assurance Specialist
description:
The Service Quality Assurance Specialist plays a key role within the Service Delivery & Quality (SDQ) department. This individual will support the senior specialist in capturing, analyzing, and translating customer insights (Voice of the Customer) into actionable strategies to enhance customer experience (CX).

Key Responsibilities:

Assist in the development and implementation of customer intelligence programs using digital tools and methodologies. Support the design and management of customer surveys, feedback mechanisms, and social listening strategies to gather VoC data. Conduct data analysis tasks under the guidance of senior specialists, identifying trends and basic customer insights. Assist in the development and maintenance of customer journey maps. Monitor and analyze customer sentiment across various channels, contributing to reports. Collaborate with the SDQ team to ensure data integrity and consistency of VoC data with other departments. Prepare presentations and reports with guidance, effectively communicating basic customer insights to stakeholders. Stay up-to-date on emerging trends and best practices in customer experience management (CEM) and customer analytics. 

Job Knowledge and Skills:

Strong interest in customer behavior and experience. Basic analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to learn quaickly and adapt to new technologies and processes. Proficient in Microsoft 365 (Word, Excel, PowerPoint). 

Years of Experience:

6 Months to 1 year of experience in a customer service, market research, or analytics role (internship experience can be considered). 

Education

Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Customer Experience, Business Administration, or a related field (in progress or recently completed preferred). Coursework or certifications in customer experience management, data analysis, or social listening are a plus. 

Other Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:

Strong interest in customer behavior and experience. Basic analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to learn quickly and adapt to new technologies and processes. Proficient in Microsoft 365 (Word, Excel, PowerPoint). 

Competencies:

Customer focusLearning agilityData literacyCommunicationCollaborationAttention to detail

Travel Required?

Occasional travel may be required.

Language:

Fluent in English

title: Performance Management Specialist
description:
The Senior Service Delivery and Analytics Specialist, KPI Performance & Analytics, plays a critical role within the Customer & Performance Intelligence (CPI) department. This individual will be responsible for developing, implementing, and maintaining a robust KPI framework to measure and monitor organizational performance.

Job Responsibilities

Partner with business stakeholders to identify and define relevant KPIs aligned with strategic objectives. Design and implement effective data collection processes for KPI measurement. Conduct in-depth data analysis to identify trends, variances, and areas for improvement. Develop and maintain KPI dashboards and reports for clear and concise communication of performance insights. Monitor KPI performance and provide timely alerts and notifications for critical deviations. Participate in the continuous review and improvement of KPI definitions and methodologies (using Kaizen & Kaikaku principles). Collaborate with the CPI Manager and other specialists to ensure data integrity and consistency across the organization. Translate complex data analysis into actionable recommendations for enhancing operational efficiency and achieving KPI targets. Prepare presentations and briefings to communicate data insights and recommendations to stakeholders. 

Education

Bachelor's degree in business administration, Statistics, data mining, or a related field. Certification in SCRUM, Six Sigma, Design Thinking, or a similar performance improvement methodology a plus. 

Language: Fluent in English is a must, Portuguese desired

Years of Experience:

Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in performance management, business intelligence or finance related. Analytical experience or job position. Proven track record of successfully developing and implementing KPI frameworks. Experience working in a cross-functional environment. 

Computer Skills:

Proficient in Microsoft 365. Experience with data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SQL). Data visualization software (e.g., Tableau, Power BI). Desirable

Job Knowledge and Skills:

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills. Strong attention to detail and accuracy. Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities effectively. Excellent communication and presentation skills.

title: Service Product Marketing Specialist
description:
Puedes ser parte de algo emocionante… con un enfoque en la movilidad, la excelencia operativa, el valor para nuestros clientes y la electrificación de los vehículos, en Nissan te estamos esperando.

Sobre el Rol:Desarrollar y consolidar una marca de refacciones y sus familias de productos a través de los diferentes canales de venta (Taller/Mostrador/Mayoreo/Flotas/Colisión). Implementando y ejecutando el Marketing Plan anual para consolidar el negocio, buscando mayor rentabilidad y venta de los diferentes productos.
Responsabilidades:Construcción y posicionamiento de marca a través de una estrategia 360 con la finalidad de consolidar la marca/categorías en el mercado.Desarrollar campañas de lanzamiento de diversas familias de productos.Análisis de competencia directa e indirecta (benchmarking), revisión de precios y monitoreo de actividades de Marketing.Desarrollo y lanzamiento de programas integrales para el impulso de productos en el punto de venta a través de promociones, ofertas, análisis financieros y proyecciones de venta para cada una de las campañas.Gestión y seguimiento de proyectos con la Agencia Creativa (campañas de lanzamiento, materiales de comunicación, pauta en medios, etc.)Coordinación de proyectos con el área de Compras para elegir a los proveedores adecuados para el desarrollo de diferentes estrategias de Marketing (artículos promocionales, stands, presencia en eventos, desarrollo de videos, etc.)Análisis e interpretación de indicadores clave de posventa (sell in, sell out, shares, Pen Rate Campañas, Control de presupuestos, etc.) elaboración de reportes para nivel Gerencial y Dirección.Conocimiento en campañas digitales (social media) y estrategia de e-commerce.Coordinación de estudios de mercado (cualitativos y cuantitativos) con la finalidad de lograr un mayor entendimiento de los consumidores.
Requisitos:

EscolaridadLicenciatura en Mercadotecnia, Comunicación, Ingeniería industrial o Administración.Especialidad o Diplomado en Marketing, Branding, Publicidad o Comunicación.
ExperienciaExperiencia en la industria automotriz, aftermarket o consumo dentro de áreas de Marketing.Experiencia en desarrollo de marcas/categorías.Desarrollo de campañas de Aftermarket.Deseable posicionamiento de productos en canal e-commerce.
Idioma - Nivel de Inglés avanzado.
Disponibilidad para viajar - Ocasional.
Computer Skills:Manejo avanzado de Excel (bases de datos, históricos de ventas, macros, reportes de análisis de ventas).
Competencias:Habilidades analíticas, enfoque a resultados, trabajo en equipo, capacidad de administrar y gestionar varios proyectos de forma simultánea.

Lo que ofrecemos:Como miembro de nuestro equipo, tendrá acceso a muchos de nuestros beneficios. Además de oportunidades integrales de aprendizaje y desarrollo profesional.
